remarks: Part of proof of Lemma E in [Crawley] p. 114, 4th line of 4th paragraph.  Whenever (in their terminology) p ` \/ ` q/0 (i.e. the sublattice from 0 to p ` \/ ` q) contains precisely three atoms, any atom not under w must equal either p or q.  (In case of 3 atoms, one of them must be u - see ~ cdleme0a - which is under w, so the only 2 left not under w are p and q themselves.)  Note that by ~ cvlsupr2 , our ` ( P .\/ r ) = ( Q .\/ r ) ` is a shorter way to express ` r =/= P /\ r =/= Q /\ r .<_ ( P .\/ Q ) ` .  Thus, the negated existential condition states there are no atoms different from p or q that are also not under w.  (Contributed by NM, 12-Nov-2012.)
